intro: Sakoanala villosa subsp. villosa, commonly known as the hairy sakoanala, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
